name: Draftaid
headline: Go from 3D models to CAD drawings using AI
description:
DraftAid is the world's first generative AI for CAD manufacturing drawings, akin to GitHub Copilot but for CAD. It drastically shortens drawing creation time, turning hours into seconds.

Every product that is manufactured - from construction to aerospace, automotive, durable goods, and electronics—relies on drawings. Currently, engineers and designers painstakingly make these essential drawings manually. Draftaid streamlines this process saving teams millions in time and quality. 

The idea was born out of Abdullah's experience as a mechanical design team member, where he created thousands of drawings and longed for a more efficient process. Partnering with Tahsin, a neighbour with a PhD in AI, and Mohammed, a seasoned engineering VP with experience in construction software, they turned the dream into reality.

Since their launch in August, DraftAid has engaged customers through targeted outreach and word-of-mouth, securing paid pilots with subsequent contracts valued at $150,000.

Be a part of ushering in the new era of CAD designs!

founders.name: Mohammed Al-arnawoot, Founder
founders.description: Founder and CEO of DraftaidHe studied Mechatronics engineering at University of Waterloo with a focus on manufacturing systems. Before DraftAid, Mohammed worked as a Director of Engineering at Dozr, a Series B construction tech company. Where he wore many hats building a rockstar engineering team to deliver a new category of product. Before that he was a VP of eng. at Emagin (acquired by Innovyze), where he lead product solution development.

founders.name: Abdullah Elqabbany, Founder
founders.description: Abdullah is an electromechanical engineer with years of experience in design and manufacturing. In his last role Abdullah led manufacturing process automation where he worked to bridge the gap between design and manufacturing. Prior to that, he worked as a drafter where he made thousands of CAD drawings shaping Toronto’s skyline. DraftAid is the culmination of years of experiences solving the biggest challenges facing teams trying to go from design to manufacturing as efficiently as possible.

founders.name: Tahsin Rahman, Founder
founders.description: Cofounder and CTO of Draftaid, Tahsin has a PhD from the University of Toronto in Electrical and Computer Engineering. He has pioneered algorithms and machine learning techniques at the intersection of geometry, wireless communications, and quantum computing. Previously, he led a team of engineers and researchers in developing cyber security AI/ML systems for the Canadian Department of National Defence.  Rewind 10 years and you would see him orchestrating instrumentation systems in Oil and Gas.

Streamline Your Fabrication Drawing Process – From Weeks to Minutes with DraftAid's Advanced AI Technology 
  * [Schedule a Demo](https://draftaid.io/<>)


Works with all major 3D modelling software
## Free designers from trivial and repetitive work
Preparing detailed drawings is tedious and error-prone. Reclaim time for actions that provide value, not busy work.
  * ### 
![Picture31](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/3f9849f7-26ab-4c2a-ad07-3463cebecbd1?optimizer=gif)
Lengthy Fabrication Drawing Process 
Traditional methods for creating 2D fabrication drawings are a major time sink, often leading to extended project timelines and increased operational costs.
  * ### 
![Picture32](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/476a2333-377c-4009-b06f-94a7c451d11f?optimizer=gif)
Misallocated Engineering Expertise 
Skilled engineers frequently find themselves tied up in repetitive drawing tasks, preventing them from focusing on more complex and innovative aspects of their work. 
  * ### 
![Picture33](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/863e243c-e8cc-4f01-8924-19d6ec639002?optimizer=gif)
Risk of Drawing Inconsistencies 
Manual drawing processes are susceptible to human error, leading to inconsistencies and inaccuracies that can cause significant downstream manufacturing issues.
  * ### 
![Picture34](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/7f42dcc8-8aa7-4d13-ade7-3c854ba92386?optimizer=gif)
Avoid Manufacturing Downtime 
Delays in design and drafting leave the manufacturing line stagnant. Teams strive to keep their manufacturing lines running constantly and uninterrupted to maximize efficiency 


## DraftAidAI-Powered Drawing Automation
DraftAid frees drafters from drawing friction and drawing errors.
  * ## Accelerate with AI
DraftAid's advanced AI technology automates the creation of fabrication drawings, dramatically reducing the time from weeks to mere minutes while ensuring precision and consistency.
![Ai 1](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/5db8d025-e50b-4a50-8989-361bac821eb5?optimizer=gif)
  * ## Integrate Seamlessly
DraftAid easily integrates with existing CAD software, enhancing your current workflow without the need for disruptive changes or extensive retraining.
![Ai 2](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/d03bab14-f928-4bea-ba3e-673cbee2bfef?optimizer=gif)
  * ## Customizable for Drawing Perfection
DraftAid offers extensive customization options to align with specific project requirements, delivering consistently accurate and high-quality drawings.
![Ai 3](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/00f577e2-75ed-4da7-a386-9b0f7d3b6d19?optimizer=gif)


  * ## Accelerate with AI
DraftAid's advanced AI technology automates the creation of fabrication drawings, dramatically reducing the time from weeks to mere minutes while ensuring precision and consistency.
  * ## Integrate Seamlessly
DraftAid easily integrates with existing CAD software, enhancing your current workflow without the need for disruptive changes or extensive retraining.
  * ## Customizable for Drawing Perfection
DraftAid offers extensive customization options to align with specific project requirements, delivering consistently accurate and high-quality drawings.


  * [See DraftAid in Action](https://draftaid.io/<>)


## Effortless Integration,
#### Exceptional Results
Streamline Your Design Process in Three Simple Steps with DraftAid
  * 1
## Seamless Integration
Easily integrate DraftAid into your existing CAD software. With just a few clicks, DraftAid becomes a part of your design toolkit, ready to transform your drawing process without disrupting your workflow. 
![Draft223](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/9fe74d67-4844-41ca-8562-067dcafeef15?optimizer=gif)
  * 2
## One-Click Automation
Initiate the drawing process with a single click. DraftAid's AI algorithm takes over, swiftly converting 3D models into precise and consistent 2D fabrication drawings, saving hours of manual effort. 
![Point2](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/23bd0491-169a-4acc-b26a-97d259c4dd13?optimizer=gif)
  * 3
## Review and Finalize
Quickly review the automatically generated drawings for peace of mind. With DraftAid's high accuracy, this step is just a formality. Finalize your designs with confidence, knowing they meet your exacting standards. 
![Pictur2e10](https://unicorn-images.b-cdn.net/79685b06-8b4e-4337-ab7f-87a544c39b91?optimizer=gif)


## Hear from Our Clients
#### Who've Transformed Their Design Process with DraftAid
## A Bit Nervous About Using DraftAid, But It's Been Great
When I first got my hands on the DraftAid demo, I was pretty excited but also a bit anxious. It seemed like a great tool to cut down on the tedious tasks, yet I was concerned that it might be tough to get the hang of and take up a lot of time. And I was really curious about how it would manage the more complex stuff, like those detailed curtainwall profiles.
Turns out, I was pleasantly surprised! I found myself quickly creating drawings with just one click, and they barely needed any extra finessing from me. What’s more, DraftAid was impressively accurate in picking up on those nuances that sometimes even the experienced drafters overlook.
Getting on board with this AI tech has really upped the game for our work. It's made our drawings more accurate, cut down on errors, and saved a bunch of time. Sure, it's not perfect yet, but the potential DraftAid has is huge. It’s making a big difference for folks in design, engineering, modeling, and fabrication by helping produce really high-quality drawings. 
J. Emata, Facade designer for 10 years
## Wasn't Sure About DraftAid, But It's Winning Me Over 
When I first came across DraftAid, to be honest, I wasn’t sure about it. Experience has taught me that AI tools have their limitations. The question nagging at me was: sure, it can crank out drawings, but would they be clear and straightforward enough for everyone on my team to understand?
Yet, as I started to use DraftAid, I've got to say it's been quite the game-changer. It's a real time-saver and consistently nails the details, especially with dimensions for holes and slots. And man, has it sped up my process of making drawings by 3X!
Of course, being an AI tool, there was a bit of a learning phase with DraftAid. I needed to invest some time to "train" it to deliver drawings the way we needed. But throughout this process, the DraftAid team was right there with me, super supportive and active.
So far, DraftAid has been impressively solid. And given the commitment I've seen from the DraftAid team, I'm pretty excited about its future in making manual drawing a thing of the past.
J. Laranjo, CNC programmer for 8 years
## Seamlessly Integrate with Your Existing Tools
DraftAid is built to seamlessly integrate with a variety of major CAD software, ensuring a smooth transition and enhancing your existing systems without the need for extensive retraining or overhaul

  * [Get in Touch](https://draftaid.io/<>)

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Draftaid**

Draftaid, founded in 2023 and based in Toronto, Canada, is revolutionizing the way we think about CAD (Computer-Aided Design). The company’s mission is clear and bold: to transition from 3D models to CAD drawings using AI—essentially compressing what used to be hours of tedious work into mere seconds. 

Imagine a tool that's like GitHub Copilot, but for CAD drawings. That’s Draftaid—dubbed the world's first generative AI designed specifically for CAD manufacturing drawings. This innovation not only streamlines the drawing creation process but also saves countless hours for engineers and designers across various sectors including construction, aerospace, automotive, durable goods, and electronics.

### Origin Story

The concept for Draftaid emerged from the firsthand experiences of co-founder Abdullah, a mechanical design team member. After generating thousands of drawings, he recognized a critical need for efficiency. Joining forces with Tahsin, an AI expert, and Mohammed, a seasoned engineering VP, they transformed that vision into the reality of Draftaid. Their collaboration has propelled the company into the limelight, securing initial pilots and contracts amounting to $150,000 since its launch in August.

### Key Features

- **AI-Powered Automation**: Draftaid dramatically accelerates the creation of fabrication drawings, minimizing the time from weeks to just minutes while maintaining high levels of precision and consistency.
- **Seamless Integration**: It works effortlessly with major 3D modeling software, enabling teams to enhance their current workflows without the chaos of extensive retraining.
- **Customization UI**: The platform is designed to be tailored for specific project requirements, which guarantees high-quality output that meets varied engineering standards.

### Reception

The early feedback from users has been overwhelmingly positive. Clients report transformative improvements, likening their experiences to a significant jump in productivity. Drawings that they previously spent countless hours on can now be generated quickly and accurately, allowing engineers to focus on more impactful tasks rather than mundane manual work. 

### Engaging With Draftaid

Draftaid is poised to lead a new era in CAD design, making it an exciting opportunity for engineers and organizations keen on boosting efficiency. With a small but dedicated team of three, and backed by the mentorship of Tom Blomfield from Y Combinator Batch W24, Draftaid is set to make waves in the construction and design industries.

For more information, or to see Draftaid in action, you can check out their website at [Draftaid.io](https://draftaid.io/) or schedule a demo to experience firsthand how they can help streamline your fabrication drawing process.

In a world where every second counts, Draftaid offers a compelling solution to an age-old problem. The future of CAD design seems not just brighter, but also much faster.
